intro: Lysinema curvatum, commonly known as the golden thread, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Americas. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, oval fruits called schizocarps, which split into two one-seeded parts when mature. Lysinema curvatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its delicate appearance and unique floral structure make it a notable species in botanical studies.
